net.sourceforge.waters.model.des

Class AutomatonTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.des.AutomatonTools

  • public final class AutomatonTools
extends Object
    A collection of static methods commonly used in combination with automata.
    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Detail

      • log2

        public static int log2(int x)
        Calculates binary logarithm.
        Returns:
        The largest number k such that 2k <= x, i.e., the number of bits needed to encode numbers from 0..x-1.

      • getFirstInitialState

        public static StateProxy getFirstInitialState(AutomatonProxy aut)
        Returns the first initial state of the given automaton, or null. This method does a sequential search and its complexity is linear in the number of states of the automaton.

      • getFirstSuccessorState

        public static StateProxy getFirstSuccessorState(AutomatonProxy aut,
                                                StateProxy source,
                                                EventProxy event)
        Returns the first successor state for the given state and event. This method does a sequential search and its complexity is linear in the number of transitions of the automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut - The automaton to be searched.
        source - The source state to be searched for.
        event - The event to be searched for.
        Returns:
        The target state of the first transition in the given automaton with matching source state and event, or null if no such transition exists.

      • createProductDESProxy

        public static ProductDESProxy createProductDESProxy(AutomatonProxy aut,
                                                    ProductDESProxyFactory factory)
        Creates a product DES consisting of a single automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut - The automaton to be used in the product DES.
        factory - Factory to construct objects.
        Returns:
        A product DES with only one automaton. The product DES name and event list are taken from the given automaton.

      • createProductDESProxy

        public static ProductDESProxy createProductDESProxy(String name,
                                                    Collection<? extends AutomatonProxy> automata,
                                                    ProductDESProxyFactory factory)
        Creates a product DES consisting of the given automata.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be given to the product DES.
        automata - The automata to be used for the product DES.
        factory - Factory to construct objects.
        Returns:
        A product DES with only the given automata. The product DES event alphabet consists of the union of the events sets of its automata in deterministic order.

      • renameAutomaton

        public static AutomatonProxy renameAutomaton(AutomatonProxy aut,
                                             String name,
                                             ProductDESProxyFactory factory)
        Creates a copy of the given automaton with another name.
        Parameters:
        aut - The automaton to be duplicated.
        name - The name to be given to the copy.
        factory - Factory to construct automaton.

      • isDeterministic

        public static boolean isDeterministic(ProductDESProxy des)
        Returns whether the given product DES is deterministic. An product DES is considered as deterministic if all its automata are deterministic.
        See Also:
        isDeterministic(AutomatonProxy)

      • isDeterministic

        public static boolean isDeterministic(AutomatonProxy aut)
        Returns whether the given automaton is deterministic. An automaton is considered as deterministic if it has at most one initial state, and whether there exists at most one transition associated with any given pair of source state and event. This method uses a hash table to perform the determinism check in time complexity linear in the number of transitions.
        See Also:
        checkDeterministic()

      • checkDeterministic

        public static void checkDeterministic(AutomatonProxy aut)
                               throws net.sourceforge.waters.model.analysis.des.NondeterministicDESException
        Checks whether the given automaton is deterministic, throwing an exception if it is not. An automaton is considered as deterministic if it has at most one initial state, and whether there exists at most one transition associated with any given pair of source state and event. This method uses a hash table to perform the determinism check in time complexity linear in the number of transitions.
        Throws:
        net.sourceforge.waters.model.analysis.des.NondeterministicDESException - to indicate that the given automaton is nondeterministic.
        See Also:
        isDeterministic()

      • findDumpState

        public static StateProxy findDumpState(AutomatonProxy aut,
                                       Collection<EventProxy> markings)
        Finds a first dump state in the given automaton. A dump state is an unmarked state without any outgoing transitions.
        Parameters:
        aut - The automaton to be searched.
        markings - The set of marking propositions to be considered. An automaton can only have dump states, if all the relevant markings are in its event set; otherwise all states are implicitly marked by some marking and there is no dump state.
        Returns:
        The first dump state found in the automaton, or null.

      • getCompositionName

        public static String getCompositionName(Collection<net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.tr.TRAutomatonProxy> automata)
        Calculates a name that can be given to a synchronous product automaton.
        Parameters:
        automata - List of automata constituting synchronous product.
        Returns:
        A string consisting of the names of the given automata, with appropriate separators between them.

      • getCompositionName

        public static String getCompositionName(String prefix,
                                        Collection<? extends AutomatonProxy> automata)
        Calculates a name that can be given to a synchronous product automaton.
        Parameters:
        prefix - A string to be prepended to the result.
        automata - List of automata constituting synchronous product.
        Returns:
        A string consisting of the prefix followed by the names of the given automata, with appropriate separators between them.

      • getComponentKindStringLowerCase

        public static String getComponentKindStringLowerCase(ComponentKind kind)
        Returns a string to describe the given component kind. This method returns a string of only lower-case characters. Possible return values are: "plant", "property", "specification", and "supervisor".

      • getComponentKindStringCapitalised

        public static String getComponentKindStringCapitalised(ComponentKind kind)
        Returns a string to describe the given component kind. This method returns a string with capitalised initial followed by lower-case characters. Possible return values are: "Plant", "Property", "Specification", and "Supervisor".
